exception.name: ErrorRegisterClientFailed
exception.description: This exception is thrown if the SE API function registerClient fails to register a new client application with the Secure Element. The function attempts to add a new client to the device's registered client list, but the registration operation fails due to device error, resource limitations, capacity constraints, or other device-level failure conditions. ErrorRegisterClientFailed indicates that the client could not be registered and is not available for performing transactions on the device.

javadoc.summary: This class defines the exception ErrorRegisterClientFailed that is thrown if the client registration operation fails.
javadoc.description: This exception is thrown when the registerClient function cannot successfully register a new client application with the Secure Element. Client registration is the process by which a client application becomes known to the device and gains the ability to perform transactions and operations. ErrorRegisterClientFailed indicates that the registration process failed at some point during the registration sequence, preventing the client from being registered. Common causes include: device resource exhaustion, client capacity limit reached, device communication failure, client ID already registered, or device internal error. ErrorRegisterClientFailed is a High severity exception that prevents client registration and must be resolved before the client can perform operations. Recovery requires investigating the cause of the registration failure and taking appropriate corrective action.

specification.requirement: The function registerClient SHALL register a new client application with the Secure Element, adding it to the device's client registry. If the registration operation cannot be completed successfully due to device error, resource limitation, capacity constraint, or other failure condition, the function SHALL raise the exception ErrorRegisterClientFailed. The client registration may fail due to: insufficient device resources, maximum client capacity reached, client ID already registered, device communication failure, or device internal error. When registration fails, the client is not added to the device's client list and is not available for subsequent operations.
specification.applicability: Client registration operations - registerClient function only

condition.description: The device lacks sufficient resources (memory, storage, etc.) to register the new client
condition.trigger: A registerClient call is made when the device is low on memory or storage. The device cannot allocate resources for the new client registration. ErrorRegisterClientFailed is raised.

condition.description: The device has reached its maximum number of registered clients
condition.trigger: A registerClient call is made when the device already has the maximum number of registered clients. The device cannot register additional clients until some clients are deregistered. ErrorRegisterClientFailed is raised.

condition.description: The specified client ID is already registered on the device
condition.trigger: A registerClient call is made with a client ID that is already registered. The device rejects duplicate client registration. ErrorRegisterClientFailed is raised.

condition.description: Communication with the Secure Element is lost during the registration operation
condition.trigger: A registerClient call begins but communication with the device is lost before the registration completes. The device cannot confirm registration completion. ErrorRegisterClientFailed is raised.

condition.description: The Secure Element reports an internal error during client registration
condition.trigger: A registerClient call is transmitted to the device but the device encounters an internal error while processing the registration (e.g., storage write failure, verification error). The device reports the failure and ErrorRegisterClientFailed is raised.

executionSequence.step: User/application calls registerClient function with client ID and other client parameters
Function validates input parameters including client ID format and validity
Function checks authorization and device state for client registration operations
Function queries device to check current registered client count and capacity
If device has reached maximum client capacity → ErrorRegisterClientFailed raised, function exits
If device has available capacity → proceed to step 5
Function checks if client ID is already registered
If client ID already registered → ErrorRegisterClientFailed raised, function exits
If client ID not registered → proceed to step 6
Function verifies device has sufficient resources for registration
If insufficient resources → ErrorRegisterClientFailed raised, function exits
If sufficient resources → proceed to step 7
Function initiates communication with Secure Element
Function transmits client registration command with client parameters to Secure Element
If communication fails → ErrorRegisterClientFailed raised, function exits
If communication succeeds → proceed to step 9
Function receives acknowledgment and client handle/ID from Secure Element
Function closes communication channel with Secure Element
Function returns successfully with client registered and client handle provided

recovery.step: Review error message - examine the error message to understand the specific registration failure reason
Check device client capacity - query the device to determine current registered client count and maximum capacity
Verify client ID is not duplicate - check if the client ID being registered is already registered on the device
Check device resources - verify the device has sufficient memory and storage for client registration
Verify device connectivity - ensure the Secure Element is accessible and communication channels are functional
Check client parameters - verify all client parameters (ID, description, etc.) are valid and within constraints
Deregister unused clients - if capacity limit reached, deregister unused or obsolete clients to free capacity
Clean up device - if resource exhaustion, perform device cleanup or reset to free resources
Retry the registration - attempt registerClient again after addressing the underlying cause
If persistent, contact device administrator - repeated registration failures may require device configuration or servicing

postconditionality.state: The new client is not registered on the device. The client is not in the registered client list.
The number of registered clients remains unchanged. The failed registration does not modify the client registry.
The device's client capacity and maximum client limit remain unchanged.
The device's overall state remains unchanged by the failed registration attempt. No cascading side effects occur.
The unregistered client cannot perform transactions or other operations that require registration.
The registration operation can be retried after addressing the underlying cause of the failure.

notes.note: ErrorRegisterClientFailed is thrown ONLY by the registerClient function - it is the specific exception for client registration failures
This exception indicates a client registration operation failure - the client is not successfully added to the device
The exception has High severity because it prevents clients from being registered and performing operations
Client registration is typically the first step in a client's lifecycle - failed registration prevents subsequent operations
Device client capacity is finite - maximum capacity is typically configurable or a device characteristic
Client IDs must be unique - duplicate client IDs cannot be registered
Different failure reasons require different recovery actions (capacity vs. already registered vs. communication error)
Applications should check device capacity before attempting registration to anticipate capacity-based failures
Some devices may require deregistration of obsolete clients to free capacity for new clients
Client registration failures should be logged and reported to administrators or support
Retry strategies should be implemented with appropriate backoff to avoid overwhelming the device
Error messages should identify the specific cause of the registration failure (capacity, duplicate, communication, etc.)
Monitoring systems should track client registration success/failure rates as a health metric
Device should maintain consistent client registry - registration failures should not leave partial or corrupt state
Administrative tools should provide means to query and manage the client registry

scenario.name: Scenario 1: Client Registration with Capacity Check
scenario.description: An application attempts to register a new client by calling registerClient. The function raises ErrorRegisterClientFailed because the device has reached its maximum client capacity. The application queries the device to check capacity, deregisters an unused client, and retries the registration.
scenario.errorContext: Client registration fails due to device capacity limit

scenario.name: Scenario 2: Duplicate Client Registration Prevention
scenario.description: An application attempts to register a client with an ID that is already registered. The registerClient function raises ErrorRegisterClientFailed with a message indicating the client ID is already registered. The application handles this by either reusing the existing registration or choosing a different client ID.
scenario.errorContext: Client registration fails due to duplicate client ID

scenario.name: Scenario 3: Device Resource Management with Registration Retry
scenario.description: An application batch registers multiple clients on a device with limited resources. When ErrorRegisterClientFailed is raised due to resource exhaustion, the application implements a backoff strategy, waits for device resources to be freed, and retries the registration.
scenario.errorContext: Client registration fails due to insufficient device resources

scenario.name: Scenario 4: Multi-Device Client Management with Failover
scenario.description: An enterprise system manages clients across multiple Secure Element devices. When client registration fails on one device, the system detects the failure and attempts to register the client on an alternate device with available capacity.
scenario.errorContext: Registration failure triggers load balancing or failover to alternate device

implementationContext.note: The registerClient function must check client capacity and available resources before attempting registration
The function must verify that the client ID is not already registered before proceeding with registration
Device client capacity is typically a device characteristic that should be documented and queryable
Registration failures should provide specific error codes or messages indicating the cause (capacity, duplicate, etc.)
The function should handle communication failures gracefully and ensure no partial registration occurs
Device client registry should be consistent and recoverable - registration failures should not corrupt state
Applications should implement client registration error handling and retry strategies
Device capacity management tools should help administrators understand and optimize client registry usage
Different device models may have different client capacity limits - this should be documented
Monitoring systems should track client registration patterns to identify capacity issues early
